pageContext.claim: “Remember I said 'Russia, Russia, Russia, if you're listening, please give us whatever was Hillary's emails or whatever.' And then everybody laughed and I left but they kept me off just before the end and they said he was asking Russia for help.”
pageContext.analysis: Many things are wrong in this retelling. Trump made his 2016 "Russia, if you're listening" request -- for help obtaining deleted Hillary Clinton emails -- at a news conference. He did not laugh when he said, he appeared serious and one cannot detect any laughter in the room. News organizations displayed the video correctly without deceptively editing.
